business.headline: Digital Form 16: Step-by-step guide to download and use it for easy ITR filingWith the advent of digital platforms, accessing and using Form 16 has become more straightforward, making it a vital document for accurate and hassle-free income tax return (ITR) filing.

Chasing Rs 10 discounts? CA explains why tracking every rupee isn't making you richIt's a common belief that managing every rupee wisely equals financial discipline. People cut back on little indulgences and chase discounts, feeling financially in control, yet, their money may be slipping away in unnoticed ways.

'Make in India' gave us breakthrough in defence, says Bharat Forge's Baba Kalyani"A lot of army guys walked by, some laughed at it," Chairman Baba Kalyani said during an episode of the New India Junction podcast  "Not a single guy stopped to even see what the hell it was."

Paramount to cut 3.5% of US jobs as cable TV declines: ReportThis is not the first round of job losses at Paramount. Back in August last year, the company had already cut 15% of its workforce, indicating ongoing adjustments in response to market changes.

Law tribunal clears merger of Inox Wind Energy Limited with Inox WindThe merger is expected to reduce liabilities by around Rs 2,050 crore. The company also expects to save costs by improving how resources are used and by simplifying various processes.
Sensex opens 86 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 104.24 points to 82,495.96, while the NSE Nifty50 added 36.70 points to 25,140.95 as of 9:31 am.

Oswal Pumps IPO to open soon with Rs 1,387 crore target. Check detailsOswal Pumps is launching an IPO aiming to raise Rs 1,387.34 crore. Here are essential details potential investors need to consider before subscribing.

Tariff cuts, easing digital barriers: India, US make headway in trade talksBoth nations are aiming for an interim trade pact by the end of June, before the pause on Trump's proposed tariffs expires. India is advocating for full exemption from a 26% reciprocal tariff on domestic goods.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty open higher today? Check key levelsSensex and Nifty closed flat on Tuesday, ending a four-day winning streak. The flat close was largely due to profit booking, especially in financial stocks.
Stocks to watch on June 11: Wipro, Reliance Infra, IndiGo, Maruti SuzukiExperts suggest that the positive sentiment is likely to persist on Dalal Street with the key support level of Nifty at 24,850.

World Bank slashes global growth forecast, cites higher tariffs and uncertaintyIn its twice-yearly Global Economic Prospects report, the bank lowered its forecasts for nearly 70 per cent of all economies as well as six emerging market regions, from the levels it projected just six months ago before US President Donald Trump took office.

Applying for a personal loan? How many years of ITRs do you needBanks need to be sure you can pay back the money you borrow. For salaried individuals, a regular pay cheque and Form 16 usually provide enough assurance. However, for self-employed individuals, ITRs over several years give a more consistent and reliable picture of earnings and financial health.

entertainment.headline: Did Shilpa Shetty scream at a tourist in Croatia? Raj Kundra reacts to viral videoActor Shilpa Shetty and her family were involved in an argument at a restaurant in Croatia after their reserved table was given to someone else. The video has since gone viral. Her husband, Raj Kundra, explained that the incident spoiled Shilpa's birthday celebration.

Let Her Go singer Passenger announces 3-city India tour. DetailsEnglish singer-songwriter Passenger is making his much-awaited India debut this year. The 'Let Her Go' hitmaker announced a three-city tour in November.

Jr NTR joins Trivikram's mythological fantasy film, producer shares cryptic postAfter much anticipation around Allu Arjun's reunion with director Trivikram Srinivas, reports now suggest a major shift. Jr NTR is reportedly set to play the lead in the long-discussed socio-mythological epic.

Celebration begins: Suriya and director Venky Atluri film goes on floorsDirected by Venky Atluri, the shooting of Tamil actor Suriya's upcoming film, tentatively titled 'Suriya 46', has begun. The film also stars 'Premalu' fame Mamitha Baiju.

Arbaaz Khan confirms wife Sshura's pregnancy with nervousness and excitementActor and producer Arbaaz Khan confirmed that he and his wife, Sshura Khan, are expecting a baby. He said his priority now is to be a present and be a supportive parent.

Ranbir Kapoor enjoys foosball match with Aamir Khan's son, Azad. WatchActor Ranbir Kapoor can be seen enjoying a match of foosball with Aamir Khan's son Azad in a viral video on social media. The actor recently attended a special screening of 'Sitaare Zameen Par' at Aamir's residence.

Actor Chum Darang condemns hate against Northeast after Raja Raghuvanshi murderActor Chum Darang, in a social media post, addressed the uproar over Raja Raghuvanshi's murder and defended crimes in Northeast India.

Karan Johar criticises Bollywood's herd mentality: We need unique ideasFilmmaker Karan Johar recently spoke about the herd mentality in Bollywood where everyone attempts to mimic successful films like 'Pushpa', 'Stree' and 'Chhaava'. He also reflected on the new trend of cinematic universes.

Panchayat 4 trailer: Manju Devi vs Kranti Devi brings fun and frustration to PhuleraIn 'Panchayat Season 4', a lot seems to be at stake with the election battle underway. As Manju Devi and Kranti Devi indulge in a tough fight, Sachiv ji once again finds himself in the middle of the village chaos.

Malayalam film Premalu 2, starring Naslen and Mamitha Baiju, delayed. Here's whyThe sequel to the 2024 blockbuster Malayalam film starring Naslen and Mamitha Baiju, 'Premalu 2', has been delayed. Producer Dileesh Pothan confirmed the same during a recent interview.

Wonder Woman 3 confirmed: Director James Gunn says slow but movingGood news DC fans! James Gunn has officially confirmed a new Wonder Woman film. In an interview, he said that the film is currently in work.

TV actors Puja Banerjee-Kunal Verma duped by close friend: We are back to zeroTV couple Puja Banerjee and Kunal Verma recently revealed that they were robbed of their entire savings by a close friend. They shared how the two are forced to start from zero now.

Actor Soundarya Sharma weighs in on Deepika Padukone-Vanga's 8-hour shift debateActor Soundarya Sharma opened up about the ongoing debate about working hours in the Indian film industry, which made headlines after Deepika Padukone's alleged request for an 8-hour workday. She emphasised mutual understanding between artists and filmmakers for better work-life balance.

Yeh Hai Mohabbatein actor Shireen Mirza, husband Hasan Sartaj welcome baby boyTV actor Shireen Mirza and her husband Hasan Sartaj welcomed their first child, a baby boy. The couple announced the news with a heartwarming post on June 11.

Panchayat 4 to arrive sooner than expected. Here's the new release date'Panchayat season 4' release has been preponed following a fan voting campaign. The new season focusses on the village Pradhan election and a blossoming romance amid political drama.

Housefull 5 box office Day 5: Akshay Kumar's film maintains fabulous 1st weekEverything is going well at the box office for Akshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5'. The film began on a strong note, and continues its momentum even as it enters its first week. Check out the first Tuesday business of the film here.

Tiger Shroff's briefs look for cricket beats the heat, but sets internet on fireTiger Shroff's viral video playing cricket wearing just a brief sparked a wave of reactions online, with fans both praising his physique and questioning his outfit. The incident led to a flurry of memes and jokes.

Taj Mahal goes missing: New promo of Disney's Elio sparks mysteryTaj Mahal can be seen vanishing into thin air in a new promo shared by Walt Disney Studios India on Instagram. The promo gives an insight into the upcoming film 'Elio'.

BBC releases Sidhu Moose Wala documentary on YouTube despite father's plea for banA documentary on Punjabi singer Sidhu Moose Wala has been released by the BBC World Service on June 11. The documentary premiered on YouTube despite Moose Wala's father's police complaint to ban the screening.

general news.headline: Bengaluru stampede an accident: Mallikarjun Kharge mentions Kumbh, CovidCalling the June 4 Bengaluru stampede an accident, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said action will be taken if there were any intentional missteps found. Kharge's comment comes amidst the demand for resignations of Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar and Home Minister G Parameshwara.

Parde mein rehne do: Pakistan's cover-up operation after Sindoor strikesFresh high-resolution satellite images analysed by India Today show Pakistan is now using tarpaulins to cover at least three military sites hit during India's Operation Sindoor.

Elon Musk regrets some of his posts on Trump: They went too farElon Musk and Donald Trump engaged in a public feud after the Tesla and SpaceX CEO stepped down from his government advisory role and criticised the Republican Party's proposed new tax bill.

Sonam told Raj she'll push husband down hill in Meghalaya if hitmen failedAfter returning to her maternal home in Indore just four days after her wedding, Sonam Raghuvanshi allegedly began plotting her husband's murder and coordinating the plan with her lover over calls.

Trump can't broker peace between his ego and reality, forget about India-Pak ceasefireFrom his trade war dud against China to burning his fingers in the Ukraine-Russia war to his fake claims of brokering India-Pak ceasefire to stoking fire in Los Angeles, it's a global Donald Trump clown show in the White House. And we are running out of patience and popcorn.

Invited whole world: Karnataka blames BCCI, RCB in court for Bengaluru stampedeAs the Karnataka High Court hears bail pleas in the Bengaluru stampede case, the state blames RCB and BCCI, alleging unauthorised planning, misinformation, and gross mismanagement that led to 11 deaths.

Liquid oxygen leak hits Indian astronaut's launch: What went wrong?SpaceX announced on Wednesday, hours before the planned launch, that the teams require more time to repair the LOx (Liquid-oxygen) leak identified during post-static fire booster inspections.

We're not saints: Ajit Pawar defends BJP tie-up as NCP merger buzz growsNCP's 26th foundation day saw separate events by Ajit Pawar and Supriya Sule, both focusing on development amid rising merger talks between the two factions.

Panchayat 4 trailer: Manju Devi vs Kranti Devi brings fun and frustration to PhuleraIn 'Panchayat Season 4', a lot seems to be at stake with the election battle underway. As Manju Devi and Kranti Devi indulge in a tough fight, Sachiv ji once again finds himself in the middle of the village chaos.

Video: Have mercy, mother appeals to another on live TV in honeymoon murder caseAs the Meghalaya honeymoon murder probe deepens, an emotional face-off unfolded on India Today between the mothers of the accused and the victim, laying personal grief, blame, and a demand for justice.

Letting children go so far...: Mohan Yadav's takeaway from Sonam Raghuvanshi caseMadhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav weighed in on the murder of Raja Raghuvanshi, calling the case a "lesson to society" and urging parents to reconsider allowing their children to travel far from home.

RT-PCR test mandatory for ministers before meeting PM amid Covid surgeAround 70 BJP functionaries from Delhi -- including the Delhi Chief Minister, all seven MPs, and MLAs -- who are scheduled to meet Prime Minister Modi at his residence this evening, will undergo an RT-PCR test, sources revealed.

Misal, Chole Bhature make India proud. Desi breakfasts crack TasteAtlas' Top 50In its latest edition of the 50 Best Breakfasts in the World, food guide TasteAtlas has named three Indian staples among the top contenders: Misal, Chole Bhature, and Paratha.

Trapped by tradition: Who killed Raja Raghuvanshi? Sonam or...?The tragic case of Raja Raghuvanshi, allegedly murdered by his wife Sonam in collusion with her lover, exposes the dark underbelly of India's marital system. This story isn't just about betrayal; it's a stark reminder of how India's obsession with family pride, caste, and tradition can eclipse individual choice, leading to devastating consequences
AC at 22°C best for your health, say expertsThe government is set to introduce a standardised AC temperature range to curb energy use. We decode why this is great news for public health.

Local emergency in LA: Curfew declared to stop looting, vandalism amid protestsAnnouncing the partial curfew, Mayor Karen Bass stated that the Los Angeles Police Department needed additional help -- but not from the Trump administration. She said the real solution to addressing the deteriorating law and order situation is for the Trump administration to 'stop the raids.'
Chances of city-killer asteroid crashing on the Moon just went upAstronomers have also constructed a 3D model of asteroid 2024 YR4 using observations conducted by the Gemini South telescope in Chile.

Bengal porn racket: Main accused detained from Kolkata, another on the runShweta Khan's mother, brothers, son, and daughter have been detained by Howrah Police for questioning in the Bengal porn racket case. Key accused Arian and Joya Khan have also been picked up, while Shweta remains absconding.

Congress expels Digvijaya Singh's brother for remarks against Rahul GandhiLast month, Lakshman Singh was served a showcause notice after he allegedly questioned how long the party would have to deal with the immaturity of both Robert Vadra and Rahul Gandhi.

BBC releases Sidhu Moose Wala documentary on YouTube despite father's plea for banA documentary on Punjabi singer Sidhu Moose Wala has been released by the BBC World Service on June 11. The documentary premiered on YouTube despite Moose Wala's father's police complaint to ban the screening.

Arbaaz Khan confirms wife Sshura's pregnancy with nervousness and excitementActor and producer Arbaaz Khan confirmed that he and his wife, Sshura Khan, are expecting a baby. He said his priority now is to be a present and be a supportive parent.

Greenland ice sheet melted 17 times faster than average in historic May heatwaveA heat-wave in places accustomed to sustaining harsh winters can prove catastrophic, according to the findings of the report. An unprecedented heatwave, like the one the region experienced last month, can result in flooding, and damage infrastructure like roads and buildings.

LA's protests swell to Chicago, Atlanta; more planned despite Trump's warningProtests over Trump's immigration raids that began in Los Angeles continued to spread across the county, with activists planning even more demonstrations in the coming days.

World's most popular TikTok star Khaby Lame leaves US after being detained in LAWorld's most-followed TikTok star Khaby Lame left the US after being detained in Las Vegas for overstaying his visa. ICE granted him voluntary departure, avoiding formal deportation and future reentry complications.

sports.headline: AUS vs SA Live Score, WTC Final 2025 Day 1: Can South Africa end Australia's reign?Australia vs South Africa Live Score, World Test Championship Final 2025 Updates: Pat Cummins and his men will be aiming to defend their crown as Australia take on South Africa in the World Test Championship final at Lord's. The Proteas finished at the top of the standings and have some big match-winners in their lineup. Can they end the Aussie dominance and claim an ICC title, ending their long wait?

Ganguly unhappy with Shreyas Iyer's absence from Tests: He can play short ballFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly is unhappy with Shreyas Iyer's absence from the Indian Test team despite his remarkable performances in recent times.

What makes Cummins a special captain? Harbhajan explains ahead of WTC FinalHarbhajan Singh praised Pat Cummins and explained what makes the pacer a special captain ahead of the World Test Championship Final against South Africa, which will begin on June 11. Cummins is chasing his second WTC title as skipper of Australia.

WTC Final 2025: How much money will India get for finishing third in the cycle?South Africa and Australia are set to lock horns in the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 at Lord's in London. Despite not being in the final for the first time in WTC, India will be taking home hefty prize money for finishing third on the points table.

After international retirement, Nicholas Pooran named captain of MI New YorkJust a day after his international cricket retirement, Nicholas Pooran has been named as the captain of MI New York ahead of the MLC 2025 season. Pooran retired from all formats for West Indies on June 10.

It's going to be tough against Australia but we've got to believe in us: Temba BavumaSouth Africa captain Temba Bavuma has acknowledged that it's going to be tough for their team to face Australia in the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025. However, the Proteas captain has faith in his team's strength to come out on top of in the all-important clash beginning from June 20 at the Lord's.

Hope returns, King gets 1st call-up as West Indies announce squad for AUS TestsShai Hope returns to the West Indies Test squad while Brandon King earns his maiden call-up for the upcoming series against Australia. The team aims to bridge the gap with fresh talent and strategic leadership under new captain Roston Chase.

Virat Kohli was unbelievable in helping me out at RCB: Jacob BethellStar England all-rounder Jacob Bethell has revealed that Indian batting stalwart Virat Kohli helped him out immensely during his stint at Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

WTC Final, South Africa vs Australia weather report: Will rain spoil the party at Lord's?Australia and South Africa meet at Lord's for the World Test Championship final starting June 11. With fans expecting a thrilling contest for the mace, will rain play spoilsport across the five days in London?

Pat Cummins on Scott Boland's exclusion from WTC final: He isn't running out of timeAustralia captain Pat Cummins said that Scott Boland was unlucky to miss out from the playing XI for the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 against South Africa.

No fear of failure in Australia, just want to play well and win: Pat CumminsAustralia captain Pat Cummins has fired a warning to South Africa ahead of the World Test Championship (WTC) final in 2025, saying that there's no fear of failure in their side ahead of the big clash. South Africa and Australia are set to lock horns in the WTC final from June 11 at Lord's.

Hope returns, King gets 1st call-up as West Indies announce squad for AUS TestsShai Hope returns to the West Indies Test squad while Brandon King earns his maiden call-up for the upcoming series against Australia. The team aims to bridge the gap with fresh talent and strategic leadership under new captain Roston Chase.

Virat Kohli was unbelievable in helping me out at RCB: Jacob BethellStar England all-rounder Jacob Bethell has revealed that Indian batting stalwart Virat Kohli helped him out immensely during his stint at Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

WTC Final, South Africa vs Australia weather report: Will rain spoil the party at Lord's?Australia and South Africa meet at Lord's for the World Test Championship final starting June 11. With fans expecting a thrilling contest for the mace, will rain play spoilsport across the five days in London?

Pat Cummins on Scott Boland's exclusion from WTC final: He isn't running out of timeAustralia captain Pat Cummins said that Scott Boland was unlucky to miss out from the playing XI for the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 against South Africa.

No fear of failure in Australia, just want to play well and win: Pat CumminsAustralia captain Pat Cummins has fired a warning to South Africa ahead of the World Test Championship (WTC) final in 2025, saying that there's no fear of failure in their side ahead of the big clash. South Africa and Australia are set to lock horns in the WTC final from June 11 at Lord's.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
